metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1380 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - high
metadata.Description:
A slab-out-of-bound read problem was found in brcmf_get_assoc_ies indrivers/net/wireless/broadcom/brcm80211/brcmfmac/cfg80211.c in the LinuxKernel. This issue could occur when assoc_info->req_len data is bigger thanthe size of the buffer, defined as WL_EXTRA_BUF_MAX, leading to a denial ofservice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1380` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-73-generic - 5.15.0-73.80
linux-image-5.15.0-73-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-73.80
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-73-generic - 5.15.0-73.80
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-73-generic-64k - 5.15.0-73.80
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-43-generic - 5.19.0-43.44~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-43-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-43.44~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-73.80').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-43.44~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1034.39').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1037.41').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1039.46').
linux-azure-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was pending [5.19.0-1027.30~22.04.2] now end-of-life').
